intro: Spiesia podoloba, commonly known as the narrow-leafed dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in spring, followed by fluffy seed heads that disperse easily. Spiesia podoloba is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid conditions.
